name: 曹筱玥
objective: This course is focused on introducing the knowledge for human-computer interaction (HCI) design, accompanying with design practice. This will allow students to understand the process of user interface design and related application, so as to be capable of practical interface design. The contents include conceptual model, interface usability, HCI process, user requirements, interface prototyping, principles of interface design and user testing. The course is preceded by means of lecturing, case study and practical work, and evaluated by students' reports, oral presentation and design work
schedule:
Week	Content
1		Course introduction
2~10	Course by Prof. Tsao
10	        Human computer system, input/output, control and display design
11		HCI theory, human cognition and mental model
12		HCI paper study and report
13		Usability engineering
14		Task analysis, information architecture
15		HCI, usability study project proposal
16		Progress discussion
17		HCI, usability study project presentation
18		Course summary and report submission
scorePolicy: Paper study and report 20%, Final project 30%
materials:
Jenny Preece, 1994, Human-Computer Interaction, Pearson: London.
Jakob Nielsen, 1993, Usability Engineering. Morgan Kaufmann: San Francisco.
Louis Rosenfeld, Peter Morville, Jorge Arango, 1998, Information Architecture. O'Reilly Media Inc: Sebastopol.
Mark Sanders, Ernest McCormick, 1986, Human Factors In Engineering and Design. McGraw-Hill Education.

name: 蕭雨青
objective:
本課程之目標在於介紹人機介面設計過程中所需了解之相關專業知識，俾使學生能在進行互動介面設計中，具備充分之理論基礎，同時了解人機介面設計之相關研究與應用，始其具有能進行人機使用者介面實務製作與企劃之能力。課程內容包含介面設計概念模式、介面使用性、人機介面設計程序、使用者需求、介面原型設計、介面設計原則以及使用者測試與評估等。教學將以課堂講授、個案研討以及實作等方式進行，並以報告繳交與課堂發表及作品為評量依據。
This course is focused on introducing the knowledge for human-computer interaction (HCI) design. Students can understand the basic knowledge, application and research relevant to HCI design, which make them to be capable of practical interface design and planning. This course is set up under the structure of Human-Machine-Scenario theory and case study. The contents include concept model of interface design, interface usability, HCI process, user requirements, interface prototyping, principles of interface design and user testing. The course is preceded by means of lecturing, case study and practical work, and evaluated by students' reports, oral presentation and design.
